SSC9503-d-06-20-95-SSC.Primary Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
SSC9503-d-06-20-95-SSC.Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
SSC9503-d-06-20-95-SSC.Narrative: AS NEAR AS WE CAN DETERMINE THIS DERAILMENT WAS PRIMARILY CAUSED BY HARMONIC ROLL CONDITIONS. TRAINPROCEEDED DOWN HILL AT MP 124, SPEED REACHED ABOUT 10 MPH AS THE ENGINEER APPLIED THE BRAKES TO CONTROL THE SPEED THE ROLL STARTED. THE HARMONIC ROLL PULLED THE FRONT WHEEL OF THE FRONT TRUCK OF UP 73885 OFF THE RAIL. WHEN WHEEL CAME DOWN IT BEGAN TO HUNT RAIL WITH FLANGE RIDING ON TOP OF THE RAIL.THE WHEEL THEN CAME OFF ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE WEST RAIL CAUSING THE REAR WHEEL OF THE FRONT TRUCKTO COME OFF THE RAIL. THIS WHEEL BEGAN TO CUT THE TIES AND LAY THE WEST RAIL OVER GIVING THE FOLLOWING CARS NO PLACE TO RIDE. AS THIS HAPPENED THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND THE FORWARD MOTION ANDSLACK ACTION CAUSED THE REST OF THE DAMAGE. THIS CAUSED THE UP 73885 TO LAY OVER ON ITS SIDE AND ASTHE OTHER TRUCKS OF THE OTHER CARS BURIED UP IN THE ROADBED, THEY CAME OFF THE TRUCKS. THIS CAUSED TRACK DAMAGE AND JACKKNIFE EFFECT. THE TRAIN CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP AT MP 123.5 AND THIS IS WHERE THE TRACK DAMAGE IS. BOTH LOCOMOTIVES AND THE 1ST CAR OF THE TRAIN REMAINED ON THE RAIL.NoneNoneNoneNone

395-d-06-04-95-PATH.Narrative: ENGINEER T. GUNNELL, #5404 AND CONDUCTOR R. DIPAULA, #7675, WERE MOVING A WORK TRAIN (CONSIST - FLAT28-1205-1244-1209) TO ASSIGNED WORK RIGHTS IN TUNNEL A3. APPROACHING SIGNAL #138Z, THE FRONT OF THEFLAT SLID TO THE RIGHT. HE APPLIED HIS BRAKE IN THE FULL SERVICE POSITION. THE #1 TRUCK OF FLAT 28DERAILED AND CAME TO A STOP 50 FT FROM THE POINT OF DERAILMENT. THE DERAILED PORTION OF THE FLAT CAUSED DAMAGE TO A SECTION OF THE THIRD RAIL AND TO SIGNAL EQUIPMENT. DAMAGE TO FLAT #28 WAS MINIMAL. TOTAL DAMAGE WAS DETERMINED TO BE $21,000. INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE #1 TRUCK FLANGE CLIMBED THE RAIL 10 FT BEFORE IT WENT ON THE GROUND AT THE BEGINNING OF THE GUARD RAIL SECTION. THE FLAT WAS COMING FROM A LEFT CURVE INTO A RIGHT CURVE ON A 4% DOWNHILL GRADE. A DESIGN DEFECT OF THIS "MINER" FLATCAR IS THE SUSPECTED CAUSE. HOWEVER, AN INSPECTION OF THIS FLAT CANNOT SUBSTANTIATE THIS AS THE PROBABLE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT. CONSEQUENTLY, WE HAVE ASSIGNED THE CAUSE CODE AS M599.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

010695100-d-06-01-95-ATSF.Narrative: IHB RR CREW DERAILED ON IHB TRACKAGE AND PULLED DERAILED CARS ONTO ATSF PROPERTY. THEY WERE DELIVERING TRAIN TO ATSF CREW. THE ENGINEER HAD REDUCED SPEED TO ASCERTAIN SWITCH POSITION AHEAD OF TRAIN AND WAS COASTING. WHEN HE SAW THE SWITCHES WERE PROPERLY LINED, HE WENT BACK TO THROTTLE POSITION 3 AND THE SLACK ACTION CAUSED BY THIS OCCURRED AT THE SAME TIME ETTX 800315 ENCOUNTERED 1/4 INCH MISMATCHED RAIL JOINT ON CURVE. THE CAR THEN DROPPED INSIDE THE RAIL AND DERAILED. THE IHB CREW DID NOT KNOW ABOUT THE DERAILMENT UNTIL TRUCK SIDE FOLLOWED SWITCH FROG AND POINTS OF CROSSOVER ON SANTA FE TRACKAGE, CAUSING EMERGENCY APPLICATION OF AIR BRAKES AS CAR ROLLED OVER SWITCH. WHILE THE IHB IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE TRACK AT INITIAL POINT OF DERAILMENT, THE $3000 LISTED IS TRACK DAMAGE ON SANTA FE TRACKAGE THAT THE CREW PULLED THE DERAILED CARS ONTO. IHB SHOWS NO TRACK DAMAGE ON THEIR REPORT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
